revised_title: Crack Analysis at the Interface of Power-Law Materials under Plane Strain Loading
tldr: The authors studied the stress fields at the tip of a crack along the interface between two incompressible power-law materials under plane strain loading. They constructed an asymptotic solution that showed the energy density near the crack tip in the material with the largest hardening parameter. The solution in the other material also showed a stress singularity, and the overall near-crack-tip solution was part of a one-parameter family of solutions. This work helps in understanding the behavior of bimaterial interfaces and aids in fracture analysis.
